title: Google execs tell employees in testy all-hands meeting that Bard A.I. isn't just about search
description: After rolling out Bard as an AI service largely for search, Google executives appear to be pivoting away from that focus without providing specific use cases.

title: The cheapest and most expensive U.S. airports to fly out of—JFK, LAX didn't make either list
description: CivMetrics collected the average cost of flights in and out of the100 busiest airports in the U.S. based on data from the Bureau of Transportation Services.

title: Tesla's investor day featured 17 execs, taking Elon Musk out of the limelight
description: One thing the Tesla Investor Day accomplished well was to turn shareholders' attention to the broader organization under Tesla's celebrity CEO.

title: Meta announces big price cuts for its VR headsets
description: Meta announced a dramatic price drop for its higher-end virtual reality headset, the Quest Pro, and for its Quest 2 headset, rolling out over the coming days.

title: Apple crackdown on ChatGPT apps unlikely, but it could impose new rules down the road
description: A email maker called Blix recently clashed with Apple over an AI-powered update to its email app, but that does not mean a ban or crackdown is imminent.

title: Oil prices turn positive after falling by $2 a barrel on a report UAE is considering leaving OPEC
description: Such a move would significantly impact on the oil producer group's global clout, and allow the UAE to pump as much oil as it wants.

title: The Russia-Ukraine war remapped the world's energy supplies, putting the U.S. at the top for years to come
description: Russia's invasion of the Ukraine a year ago has shifted global energy supply chains and put the U.S. clearly at the top of the world's energy-exporting nations.

title: Oil companies hit with backlash after bringing in $200 billion in profits last year
description: Oil prices skyrocketed in 2022 and firms such as ExxonMobil, Shell, Chevron, TotalEnergies and BP earned record profits. But that spurred backlash.

title: Persistent underinvestment in the oil sector will keep global supply tight, Aramco CEO says
description: The number of U.S. oil rigs in use as of the end of February is at its lowest since early July 2022, according to oilfield services company Baker Hughes.

title: The U.S. has warned on China's support for Russia. Now the EU says 'we need to remain vigilant'
description: The West needs to be vigilant when it comes to potential support for Russia from China, Europe's top diplomat said.

title: British chip giant Arm chooses New York listing in a blow to London
description: British chip designer Arm and building materials group CRH are planning to pursue a listing in the U.S., dealing a blow to London.

title: Tesla is not the only company reviewing its Europe investment after Biden's IRA
description: Many multinationals are reconsidering or changing previous plans to deploy new money into Europe.

title: India's Supreme Court sets up panel to investigate Adani allegations
description: India's supreme court has set up an independent panel to investigate if there were any regulatory failures related to allegations against the Adani Group.

title: 'Bregret'? Many Brits are suffering from Brexit regret
description: Almost seven years and four prime ministers since the U.K. voted to leave the European Union, polling suggests public sentiment has turned against Brexit.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Markets rallied as Fed official renewed investors' hope for 25 basis-point hike
description: Markets digested mixed messages on Thursday and eventually overcame fears of higher rates to stage a last-minute rally.

title: What to expect from China's 'Two Sessions' meeting kicking off this weekend
description: The Chinese government is set to announce its GDP target and new premier in coming days as part of its annual meeting.

title: Huawei spin-off Honor takes aim at Samsung in foldables; shrugs off U.S. sanction concerns
description: Honor launched two high-end smartphones this week — the Magic Vs and Magic5 Pro — as the Chinese smartphone maker looks to take on Samsung and Apple.

title: Chinese stocks often gain after the country's annual congress meeting. Here's what strategists expect this year
description: China's stocks often see a modest rally after the country's party congress sessions, but economists and strategists are mixed on what to expect this year.

title: Ericsson pleads guilty in U.S. to federal bribery violations, agrees to pay $206 million penalty
description: Ericsson agreed to pay over $200 million after it pleaded guilty to violating the anti-bribery provisions of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.

title: China is rolling out the red carpet to attract foreign executives
description: China is pulling out all the stops to keep multinationals like Apple and its supplier Foxconn in the country.
